newsitem.title: ITALY: RESEARCH ALERT-Buy stays on Tim at Salomon.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Buy stays on Tim at Salomon.

text.p: Italian mobile phone operator Telecom Italia Mobile maintained a buy recommendation at Salomon Brothers, the U.S. investment bank said in a note on Friday.
"TIM continues to be our top pick of the sector and we reiterate our Buy recommendation with a target price of 5,600 lire. TIM was trading at 5,255 lire on Friday afternoon.
Salomon said TIM, which operates the biggest cellular phone network in Europe with 6.25 million subscribers, had signed up 547,000 news subscribers in the first quarter of the year.
The investment bank said its forecast of two million new subscribers for the whole year may prove conservative "considering that the Easter and Christmas quarters are normally the strongest".

It said the recent purchase of a 25 percent stake in Austrian mobile phone company Mobilkom by Stet Mobile Holding, in which TIM has a 49 percent stake, for $700 million was "definitely a full valuation."
Mobilkom could expect to face increased competition in Austria from recently launched Maxmobil and from a third operator as soon as a licence is awarded.
